result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Alexander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert L Alexander is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert L Alexander was found guilty of Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Robert L Alexander was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2: Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 8.31.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 8.31.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
With credit for 93 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L Alexander

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of GUILTY PLEA/SENTENCING commencing 06/30/2015 received and filed. (30 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION.

Defendant Robert L Alexander in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Robert L Alexander in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On State's motion, Court ordered COUNT 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armour. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.    Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

 
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 20 YEARS CONCURRENT, with credit for 93 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS CONCURRENT, with credit for 93 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 8.31.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 8.31.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
 Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form;

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Robert L Alexander not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-30-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Robert L Alexander not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-29-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert L Alexander in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Robert L Alexander in custody.  Antoni Apollo for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tracy H dob 1/22/86 or his residence and Dewitt B. dob 3/3/77

Defendant Robert L Alexander in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Robert L Alexander in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
